genresAdvancedInfo.name: pre-war blues
genresAdvancedInfo.description: Pre-war blues refers to the blues music that was recorded and popularized in the United States before World War II. This genre is characterized by its raw, emotional vocals, acoustic guitar or piano accompaniment, and themes of love, loss, and hardship. Pre-war blues is an important precursor to many modern music genres, including rock and roll, soul, and R&B.
